snippet: The United States Tennis Association will spend hundreds of millions of dollars to upgrade the Billie Jean King National Tennis Center, but those plans don’t include a roof for Arthur Ashe Stadium.
abstract: United States Tennis Association will spend hundreds of millions of dollars to upgrade the Billie Jean King National Tennis Center, but those plans don’t include a roof for Arthur Ashe Stadium; officials say that Arthur Ashe Stadium, which was built on a swamp-like ash dump, could not physically absorb the weight of a roof that would cover its expanse.
lead_paragraph: The United States Tennis Association will spend hundreds of millions of dollars to upgrade the Billie Jean King National Tennis Center, but those plans don’t include a roof for Arthur Ashe Stadium.

headline.seo: New Stadiums, but No Roofs, Are Planned at National Tennis Center
headline.main: Tennis Center Could Get New Stadiums (but No Roof)
headline.print_headline: Big Plans for Open, but Not for a Roof
